block.p: LECTURE AND SLIDE SHOW, South Street Seaport, Museum Gallery, 213 Water Street, Manhattan. A discussion of exploration in the 16th century by Gerald Milanich of the Florida Museum of Natural History, Sunday at 2 P.M. Free with museum admission, $6 ($3 for children). Information: (212) 669-9400.

SCREENING AND DISCUSSION, Karen Horney Clinic, auditorium, 329 East 62d Street, Manhattan. Screening of the Woody Allen film "Interiors," followed by discussion of the characters led by Milton M. Berger, president of the Association for the Advancement of Psycholanlysis, today at 7:30 P.M. Contributions accepted. Information: (212) 838-8044.

LECTURE AND SLIDE SHOW, South Street Seaport, Museum Gallery, 213 Water Street, Manhattan. A discussion of exploration in the 16th century by Gerald Milanich of the Florida Museum of Natural History, Sunday at 2 P.M. Free with museum admission, $6 ($3 for children). Information: (212) 669-9400.

SCREENING AND DISCUSSION, Karen Horney Clinic, auditorium, 329 East 62d Street, Manhattan. Screening of the Woody Allen film "Interiors," followed by discussion of the characters led by Milton M. Berger, president of the Association for the Advancement of Psycholanlysis, today at 7:30 P.M. Contributions accepted. Information: (212) 838-8044.

DISCUSSION, Juilliard School, Paul Hall, 144 West 66th Street. With Mitsuko Uchida, a pianist known for her interpretation of Mozart pieces, who will speak with Neal Zaslaw, an adviser to the Mozart Bicentennial at Lincoln Center, Sunday at 6 P.M. Admission, $13. Information: (212) 877-1800, extension 633.

GALLERY TALKS AND LECTURES, at the Whitney Museum of American Art, 945 Madison Avenue, at 75th Street. "The 1991 Biennial" by Leslie Heiner, tomorrow and Sunday at 2 and 3:30 P.M. Free with museum admission: $5 ($3 for the elderly; free for students). Information: (212) 570-3611.

LECTURE, 92d Street Y, at Lexington Avenue, Manhattan. With Jane Bryant Quinn, a columnist, who will discuss personal financial management, Sunday at 7:30 P.M. Tickets, $14. Information: (212) 996-1100.

LECTURE-SCREENING, 92d Street Y, at Lexington Avenue, Manhattan. With Lawrence Meyer, author of "Israel Now: Portrait of a Troubled Land," who will discuss the image of Arabs in Israeli films, following screening of the film "They Were 10," Sunday at 7:30 P.M. Tickets, $8. Information: (212) 996-1100.

LECTURE, New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, at 77th Street, Manhattan. With James Young, an author and associate professor of English and Judaic Studies at the University of Massachusetts, who will discuss ways in the which the Holocaust is remembered, Sunday at 7:30 P.M. Tickets are $8 ($5 for the elderly). Information: (212) 399-3368.

LECTURE AND SCREENING, Museum of the City of New York, Fifth Avenue at 103d Street. Screening of the film "From Shore to Shore: Irish Traditional Music in New York," followed by a discussion with the film makers Patrick Mullin and Rebecca Miller, tomorrow at 1 P.M.; lecture on Irish music on Broadway by John Ridge, a historian, tomorrow at 2:30 P.M. Fee, $3. Information: (212) 534-1672, extension 260.

LECTURE, American Numismatic Society, Broadway at 155th Street, Manhattan. With Robert D. Van Arsdell, author of "Celtic Coinage of Britain," who will discuss the "Coinage of the American Iron Age," tomorrow at 3 P.M. Free. Information: (212) 234-3130.

LECTURE, Brooklyn Historical Society, 128 Pierrepont Street, in the Brooklyn Heights section. With Rabbi Mier Fund, who will speak about dream interpretation from the point of view of the Jewish Mystics of Eastern Europe, Sunday at 2 P.M. Free with museum admission, $2.50 ($1 for those under 12). Information: (718) 624-0890.
